Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert 16-bit signed integer objects to and from other representations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This converter can only convert a 16-bit signed integer object to and from a string. The <xref:System.Int16> value type represents signed integers with values ranging from negative 32768 through positive 32767.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.ConvertFrom%2A> method uses the <xref:System.Int16.Parse%2A> method of <xref:System.Int16> with the integer value of <xref:System.Globalization.NumberStyles>.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.ConvertTo%2A> method uses the general ("G") format for the string returned.
For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/visualstudio/visual-studio-2013/ayybcxe5(v=vs.120)).
> [!NOTE] > You should never create an instance of an <xref:System.ComponentModel.Int16Converter>. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.
## Examples The following code example converts a variable of type <xref:System.Int16> to a string, and vice versa.
